event: Acting OPM Director Charles Ezell replaces existing CIO Melvin Brown with Greg Hogan
The DOGE team moves into OPM, installing sofa beds and armed security
An Inaguration Day executive order renames the USDS to the US Doge Service and implants the DOGE temporary organization inside of It
Marko Elez starts at the Treasury Department and is granted full read-write access to systems
DOGE staff start screening all USDS staff in interviews, asking them their views of DOGE and who were underperformers who should be fired.
Thomas Krause starts at the Treasury Department
Commerce Department Inspector General is fired in a late-night purge
Trump fires the USDA Inspector General in a late-night purge
Trump fires the DoD Inspector General in a late-night purge
Trump fires the Inspector General for the Department of Education in a late-night purge
Trump fires the Inspector General for the Department of Energy in a late-night purge
Trump fires the Inspector General for the Department of Labor in a late-night purge
Treasury Chief of Staff Dan Katz sends an email stating that DOGE staff need to be given access to pause USAID payments
Trump fires the Inspector General for the Department of the Treasury in a late-night purge
Trump fires the EPA Inspector General in a late-night purge
Trump fires the HHS Inspector General in a late-night purge
Trump fires the OPM Inspector General in a late-night purge
Trump fires the SBA Inspector General in a late-night purge
Trump fires the VA Inspector General in a late-night purge
Spurred by rumors there would be a funding freeze, HUD grantees drew their funds early at 5x normal rate or $1.5 billion
A DOGE official first arrives at USAID. Later, senior staff are summoned to a meeting with Gavin Kliger and Luke Farritor.
According to his sworn testimony, Adam Ramada started working at the Department of Education on this date. He says there is one other USDS staffer with him, two other detailees and two DOE staffers.
Two DOGE staffers attempted to force water pumps to be turned on in a large reservoir in California for a photo op
OPM sends out the "Fork in the Road" email to all federal employees offering them a chance to resign
Leland Dudek reaches out to Tiffany Flick, the Associate Director of Budget, Facilities and Security to inform her two DOGE staff would be onboarding. He was a mid-level employee at the time.
DOGE discovers that some USAID grants had been paid automatically through HHS despite a declared freeze
Farritor and Kliger demanded that all senior managers be stripped of their power to authorize payments — and that they alone become the authorizers.
Federal employees at OPM are locked out of access to key systems by DOGE and OPM leadership
Mike Russo begins onboarding as new CIO, introduces himself as a DOGE representative to staff
USAID Director of Security and deputy placed on administrative leave for trying to prevent DOGE from accessing personnel files and classified data
USAID website and 6 other related websites are taken offline by DOGE
Approximately 2000 USAID email accounts are deactivated
Elon Musk posts a series of tweets calling USAID evil and saying it is "time for it to die"

Twenty DOGE staff are in the agency and "have gained access to multiple sensitive internal systems, the people said, including a financial aid dataset that contains the personal information for millions of students enrolled in the federal student aid program."
Email to SBA staff announces that Edward Coristine was granted access to all systems including HR, contract, and payment systems.
Democrats on the House Committee on Small Business send a letter requesting details on DOGE's operations at SBA
Mike Russo officially joins the agency as its new CIO, requests Akash Bobba to join the agency (but he has issues with his background check)
An email informing USAID staff that the building was closed included Gavin Kliger's email address
Elon Musk tweets that he and President Trump are shutting down USAID, bragging he had fed the agency "into the wood chipper"
DOL staff reportedly ordered "to give DOGE access to whatever they ask for—or risk termination"
Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent writes a letter to Congress about Scott Krause having read-only access but doesn't mention Marko Elez
Gauiter "Cole" Killian appears in an EPA internal directory as a "Federal Detailee"
DOGE staff enter NOAA facilities
All USAID staff are informed by email they will soon be placed on indefinite administrative leave
A representative from DOGE was given access to contracting systems as well as information on VA operations and information technology systems.

agency: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services
event: DOGE staff reported with agency buildings with access to certain systems
DOGE staff enters the Commerce Department
Luke Farritor was granted access to the Energy Department's IT system on Wednesday by Energy Secretary Chris Wright over objections from agency security staff
DOGE staff are given access to the Department of Labor IT systems
Elon Musk promises that DOGE will make rapid upgrades to airline systems after outage of NOTAM alerting system
Edward Coristine is given a FEMA badge and onboarded into the agency
NOAA employees were ordered to grant Rajpal editor access to all NOAA Google sites on instructions of the acting commerce secretary, Jeremy Pelter, by the close of business.
OPM attests the government-wide email system runs on agency systems

agency: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
event: DOGE staff arrive at CDC HQ in Atlanta
DOGE staff enter CFPB facilities and are given equipment and onboarded
The Washington Post reports that DOGE is feeding Department of Education data into an AI system hosted in Microsoft Azure
Judge Colleen Kollar-Kotelly rules that DOGE should only be granted read access to government systems
Marko Elez was discovered to inappropriately have read-write access on his laptop
Marko Elez resigns allegedly after past racist tweets are revealed (but also same day as being discovered with write access)
DOGE staff attempt to use access to Treasury systems to stop payment to USAID programs
DOGE staff are granted read-only access to the HR, PRISM, and Discoverer systems
Elon Musk posts a tweet "CFPB RIP" with a tombstone emoji
DOGE staff are given full privileged access to CFPB systems without completing training or agreeing to CFPB's acceptable use policy for IT systems
The CFPB homepage is deleted and returns a 404 error
Ryan Riedel, a SpaceX network security engineer with 4 years of experience, is named the CIO for the agency
Sources indicate that 3 unidentified DOGE personnel are working at the Department of Energy
168 employees who worked on environmental justice are placed on indefinite administrative leave
A lawsuit filed by multiple labor organization (and others) alleged that DOGE wants to access whistleblower information at OSHA
All USAID staff are placed on indefinite administrative leave
NBC News reports that Akash Bobba and Ethan Shaotran have admin access to email and had also accessed the website backend
Gavin Kliger and Luke Farritor completely remove all access to the payments system for all other USAID staff
Edward Coristine appears in a DHS directory as a "senior advisor"
Affadavit states a BFS payment was presented to State Department to not process after review by DOGE
NOTAM has its name changed from Notice to Air Missions back to its original name of Notice to Airmen
Employees at HUD receive an email from Scott Langmack asking them to list every contract at HUD and whether it is critical and/or has DEI components
Mike Russo, DOGE chief of staff Steve Davis both demand that Akash Bobba be onboarded before midnight.
CIO Mike Russo convenes his own internal informational group in SSA, has conversations with other agencies about data sharing, does not inform acting SSA Director, Michelle King
Akash Bobba is rapidly trained and is granted access to anonymized and read-only "sandbox" NUMIDENT data for his purported fraud investigations
Edward Coristine and Luke Farritor are posted to the State Department's Bureau of Diplomatic Technology
A day after a conservative activist flagged it on X, DOGE posts it has removed gender identity options from a VA form
CFPB Contracting Officers (COs) are ordered to terminate the vast majority of CFPB's contracts during that weekend
Department of Education agreed to block DOGE from access to financial aid systems
Affadavit states Marko Elez was accidentally given edit access to BFS systems but did not use it
USAID Inspector General is illegally fired after releasing a report critical of DOGE's actions
Adam Martinez, CFPB COO, includes DOGE representatives in emails hiring OPM for consulting on Reduction-in-Force planning for the CFPB
Dozens of workers within the Technology Transformation Service (TTS) are fired.
Jordan Wick demands for mass termination notices to be sent to CFPB employees by February 14
DOGE is granted authorization to use file transfer software
Gavin Kliger arrives at the IRS to begin onboarding
The CFPB's social media accounts are deleted and videos are removed from its YouTube channel
In a speech, Secretary of Agriculture says DOGE has been at the agency for "a few weeks"

After a conservative account complained to Musk on Twitter about gender options on the FAFSA form, it was changed the same day (a change was planned, but multiple contractors were called in to rush it)
388 probabtionary employees are fired
NASA administrator emails all staff to report that "DOGE has arrived"

agency: National Institute of Standards and Technology
event: NIST workers witness a handful people they suspect of being DOGE at NIST IT facilities in Gaithersburg, MD
Leland Dudek is placed on administrative leave while under investigation that he committed inappropriate actions to help DOGE
USDA accidentally includes official working on H5N1 response in mass firings of probationary employees

Akash Bobba reports issue with the "sandbox" data. Russo demands he gets immediate full access to Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW), Master Beneficiary Record (MBR) and Supplemental Security Record (SSR) files as well as source code
Staff express concern to Acting Commissioner King that Bobba is accessing information remotely and in an insecure location (the OPM)
4 SpaceX engineers were onboarded into the FAA under the Schedule A hiring authority for people with disabilities
White House pressures the IRS to sign a MOU granting DOGE expanded access to internal systems
The acting director of the Social Security Administration, Michelle King, receives an email from the White House that Dudek is now the Acting Commissioner.
The SpaceX engineers are granted ethics waivers and designated as Special Government Employees, but must recuse from decisions affecting SpaceX
The head of the medical device safety division is fired amid mass layoffs
The head of the agency's food safety division resigns because of 89 employees being indiscriminately fired
White House official confirms one DOGE staffer will be working with an IRS employee to access IRS systems
SEC staff report the imminent arrival of DOGE to to the agency

A USAID official under Trump testifies that "changes in the process by which payments can be made and approved by the Agency over the past weeks." in the payment system were causing certain allowance statements to be delayed
An employee requests to repair the CFPB homepage deleted by DOGE, but that action is refused by order of Vought
Unidentified DOGE team has a kickoff meeting with DoD staff at the Pentagon
DoD agencies are ordered to provide lists of probationary employees to DOGE
A federal judge denied an attempt to block DOGE from accessing Department of Education systems related to financial aid
Malaska declares that SpaceX is the only company able to complete a communications network contract already awarded to Verizon, threatens to report anybody blocking his work to Musk
A GSA employee resigned rather than give unrestricted admin access of Notify.gov to Thomas Shedd
Privacy advocates sue to stop DOGE acess to IRS systems
CNN reporter shares that a FOIA request about DOGE was replied to with "they just fired the whole privacy team"
Senate Democrats send letter to VA Secretary demanding information about DOGE's activities there

agency: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
event: Staff at the CDC CIO's office report not being contacted by DOGE yet
Edward Coristine and Kyle Schutt are given access to CISA systems
Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says only one person from DOGE is "looking at an outdated IT system, that's all they're doing."
Thomas Shedd has allegedly requested admin access to 19 different systems within TTS at GSA

According to one agency employee, DOGE workers already have access to contracts, partnerships, performance reviews, classified national-security information, and satellite data, among other materials.
Division leaders at the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency informed some senior CISA staffers that DOGE has access to internal emails and Microsoft Teams chats of employees.
Defense Secretary Hegseth releases a video stating that he met with DOGE about cuts to the agency and many of them are veterans
John York, a senior counselor to Bessent, wrote in a sworn statement that Ryan Wunderly would take over Marko Elez's work at the BFS
The White House and Treasury Department come to an agreement about how DOGE access to IRS systems will be structured
In a court filing, Treasury says it is adding two more DOGE staffers focused on the IRS
Several DOGE staffers at the agency are identified by Social Security Works (a nonprofit advocacy group) as also working at SSA
The Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) between the IRS and DOGE is signed, will not let DOGE access individual tax returns

In a ruling, a judge declared "DOGE affiliates have been granted access to systems of record that contain some of the plaintiffs’ most sensitive data — Social Security numbers, dates of birth, home addresses, income and assets, citizenship status, and disability status — and their access to this trove of personal information is ongoing"
A court ruling names the systems NSLDS, COD, FAS and FMS as being accessed by DOGE

Reports that DOGE have accounts are working with the NIH Business System Department for NIH’s central electronic business system, which includes finance, budget, procurement, a property-management system, and a grant-tracking system
GSA reportedly spending $25,000 to install a washer and dryer near a makeshift sleeping area occupied by DOGE
The Post reports that DOGE is being granted access to only anonymized data from IDRS
DOGE engineer Ricardo Biasini is reported to be working on updating software to automate Reduction-in-Force (RIF) processes
21 USDS staff publicly resign in protest of DOGE's actions

Wired reports that DOGE staff were given read-only access to some systems and read-write access to payment systems within HUD as well as the centralized authorization system that grants access to other systems (date unknown)
Thomas Shedd, an engineer who has worked 8 years at Tesla, is named the head of GSA's Technology Transformation Services (TTS)

Gavin Kliger and Sam Corcos, DOGE representatives embedded at the tax agency, on Friday asked IRS lawyers to assist in creating an “omnibus” agreement with other federal agencies that would allow a broad swath of federal officials to cross-reference benefits rolls with taxpayer data
TTS administrator Thomas Shedd eliminates 90 members of 18F with a 1am firing email and locks them out of their machines
Hours after the staff is hit with the RIF email, the DNS entry for 18F.gsa.gov is removed
In an email to staff, Dudek explains the disruptions by saying "elections have consequences"

DOGE staff attempt to access "a system within a broader government database created to help enforce child support payments, which pulls a vast trove of information, including income data linked to nearly all workers"
The head of HR, Traci DiMartini, is placed on administrative leave for refusing to bring in employees over the weekend to onboard Sam Corcos
Wired reports that some DOGE staff (Kyle Schutt, Nate Cavanaugh) are being paid in the GSA, but others are listed as volunteers for that agency

In a meeting, Dudek stresses again that DOGE will make mistakes and also admits "I am receiving decisions that are made without my input. I have to effectuate those decisions," suggesting DOGE is in charge.
Business Insider reports Marko Elez, Aram Moghaddassi, and Miles B. Collins are new DOGE arrivals at Department of Labor
Jacob Altik and Ethan Shaotran are rebuffed by agency leadership when attempting to enter the agency
Thomas Shedd says in a statement that he expects TTS will be 50% smaller within weeks
DOGE staff Jacob Altik and Ethan Shaotran return joined by Nate Cavanaugh with US marshals to force entry to the agency
DOGE rolls out a custom GSAi custom chatbot to 1500 workers
DOGE staff are granted access to NDNH and objecting federal staff are "no longer with the agency"
Multiple SSA employees told ProPublica, their tech systems seem to be crashing nearly every day, leading to more delays in serving beneficiaries.
